definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: You can feel new ideas and plans cooking up in your head.
sentences.chinese: 你的大脑能在烹饪时迸发出新鲜的想法与计划。

sentences.english: The ancient Chinese civilization has been revitalized.
sentences.chinese: 文明古国迸发出前所未有的青春活力。

sentences.english: Just as she remembers his words, she remembers the brushback stirring her competitive juices.
sentences.chinese: 当她忆起他的话，心头就迸发出竞争的激情。

sentences.english: Since then, the Chinese society has shown unprecedented vigor and creativity.
sentences.chinese: 中国社会迸发出前所未有的活力和创造力。

sentences.english: Some sparks from a passing train set the haystack on fire.
sentences.chinese: 列过往火车迸发出的一些火花点着了干草堆。

sentences.english: It landed on a pile of firewood where the yellow yolk burst into flames.
sentences.chinese: 鸟蛋掉到一堆柴火上，蛋黄随即迸发出黄色的火焰。
火焰跳跃着迸发出火星。

sentences.english: She then sings the second stanza by herself, giving the song some real smolder.
sentences.chinese: 在第二段中她单独演唱，让这首歌迸发出了火花。

sentences.english: If often leaps out of the flames.
sentences.chinese: 如果经常迸发出这种火焰。

definition: to gush/to squirt/to surge/to well out/to overflow
to hold in store/to contain (untapped reserves etc)
to sprout up/to flourish/(of war etc) to break out/rapid growth
to condense/to coagulate/coacervation (i.e. form tiny droplets)/aggregation/coherent
